answers.answer: The cholesterol that we generally focus on is LDL and HDL. As you stated, your HDL is good. Depending on your concurrent medical conditions, your LDL may be at a good level as well -- 110 is actually quite good. People who need their LDL less than 100 are people with history of stroke, diabetes, coronary artery disease, prior heart attacks, peripheral vascular disease, or carotid artery disease. If you don't have any of these, then I'd leave well enough alone and ignore the total cholesterol. If you are really worried, you could see a Preventative Cardiologist, who would know much more about the different cholesterols and how to deal with them.

title: super high HDL
